oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. George W. James to Francis Marion James
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. G. W. James, Co. H, 12th Tenn. Inf. (later Co. F, 47th Tenn. Inf.) writes to his brother in Gibson County from a camp near Sweetwater, Tenn. He tells of being where the "terrible thunder of cannons & deafening roar of musketry played their destruction." He describes Chickamauga as a hard fought battle in which Brig. Gen. Smith was killed. He mentiones action at Chattanooga, a successful cavalry fight by Biffle, and the burned bridge at Loudon over the Tennessee River.
